title: GenAI Basics
description: Foundational concepts for understanding Generative AI
intro: This page focuses on foundational GenAI concepts: understanding the history, learning key terminology, and seeing how GenAI fits into the broader AI and machine learning landscape.

tableOfContents.title: Next-token prediction: How LLMs generate text

sections.title: History
sections.intro: Some fun history facts about AI, showing how long AI has been around and how it has evolved over time.

sections.title: ML vs AI vs GenAI
sections.intro: Understanding the relationship between these three concepts is essential for anyone starting their AI journey. While often used interchangeably, they represent distinct but nested domains—each building upon the other.

subsections.title: Machine Learning
subsections.content: Machine Learning (ML) is a method of data analysis where computers learn to identify patterns in data without being explicitly programmed for each task. Think of it as teaching a computer to recognize cats in photos by showing it thousands of cat pictures, rather than writing specific code that says "a cat has pointed ears, whiskers, and four legs."

subsections.title: Artificial Intelligence
subsections.content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a broader field that includes machine learning but also encompasses other approaches to creating intelligent systems. AI aims to create machines that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as reasoning, learning, planning, and understanding language.
list: Rule-based systems: Follow pre-defined logical rules and conditions
Expert systems: Capture human expertise in specific domains through knowledge bases
Symbolic AI: Uses symbols and logic to represent knowledge and reasoning
Evolutionary algorithms: Solve problems by mimicking natural selection
Fuzzy logic: Handles uncertainty and partial truths

subsections.title: Generative AI
subsections.content: Generative AI (GenAI) is a specific type of AI that can create new content - text, images, code, music, or other types of data. When you ask ChatGPT to write a story or use DALL-E to create an image, you're using generative AI. GenAI models learn patterns from existing content and use that knowledge to generate new, original content that follows similar patterns.

sections.title: About Generative AI
sections.intro: Generative AI encompasses a range of technologies that can create new content—text, images, code, audio, and more. This section explores the foundational concepts, from natural language processing to the different types of models powering today's AI applications.

subsections.title: Natural Language Processing
subsections.content: Understanding Generative AI begins with Natural Language Processing (NLP), the foundational branch of AI that enables computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language.

subsections.title: Large Language Models (LLMs)
subsections.content: Large Language Models represent the current pinnacle of NLP technology. These AI systems are trained on enormous datasets containing billions of text examples. Popular examples include GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini.

subsections.title: Small Language Models (SLMs)
subsections.content: Small Language Models serve the same fundamental purpose as their larger counterparts but prioritize efficiency and accessibility. Examples include Microsoft's Phi models.

subsections.title: Specialized model types
list: Diffusion models (DALL-E, Stable Diffusion, Midjourney) generate images from text
Speech recognition models (Whisper) convert spoken words to text
Music generation models (Suno, Udio) create original compositions
Multimodal models (GPT-4o) work with text, images, audio, and video

sections.title: Vendors
sections.intro: AI vendors are companies that develop, train, and provide access to AI models. Each vendor brings different strengths, approaches, and business models to the market.

vendors.name: OpenAI
vendors.description: Creator of the GPT series and DALL-E, known for ChatGPT and pioneering conversational AI

vendors.name: Google
vendors.description: Develops Gemini models and provides AI services through Google Cloud

vendors.name: Anthropic
vendors.description: Focuses on AI safety and creates the Claude family of models

vendors.name: Microsoft
vendors.description: Partners with OpenAI and develops its own models while integrating AI across its product suite

vendors.name: Hugging Face
vendors.description: Acts as a platform for sharing and hosting AI models, both open-source and commercial

moreInfo.text: Azure OpenAI and Microsoft Foundry models

sections.title: Models
sections.intro: A model is the actual AI system that has been trained to perform specific tasks. Think of it as a specialized brain that has learned patterns from data and can apply that knowledge to new situations.

models.name: GPT series (4, 4o, 4.1, 5)
models.description: OpenAI's flagship models for text generation and reasoning

models.name: Claude (3.5 Sonnet, 4 Sonnet, 4 Opus)
models.description: Anthropic's models focused on helpful, harmless, and honest interactions

models.name: Grok
models.description: xAI's conversational AI model with real-time information access

models.name: Phi-4
models.description: Microsoft's efficient model designed for smaller devices

faq.question: What is a GPT and why are not all models GPT?
faq.answer: GPT stands for "Generative Pre-trained Transformer." It's a specific architecture developed by OpenAI. Not all models use this architecture - companies develop different approaches to achieve similar goals.

faq.question: What does multimodal mean?
faq.answer: Multimodal models can understand and generate multiple types of content - not just text, but also images, audio, and video.

faq.question: Why not train a model every week to keep it up-to-date?
faq.answer: Training large AI models requires enormous computational resources, costs millions of dollars, and takes weeks or months to complete.

nextPage.title: Ready for Advanced Concepts?
nextPage.description: You've mastered the fundamentals! Dive deeper into advanced GenAI techniques, architectures, and implementation patterns.
